intro: Samolus cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray samolus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows or along stream banks. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive ash-gray appearance when dry. Samolus cinerascens is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate foliage and flowering habit.
